intro: Acinodendron rigens, commonly known as the rigid acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a rough texture. Acinodendron rigens is adapted to thrive in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories.
